      • checkLimit

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String checkLimit(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockPlaceEvent event,
                                   boolean doBypassCheck)
        If the player has not yet maxed out his limits, it will add the placed block to his limits.
        Returns:
        Whether a player has already maxed out their limits.
        See Also:
        Used by TRListener.onBlockPlace(BlockPlaceEvent)

      • checkBreakLimit

        public void checkBreakLimit(@NonNull
                   org.bukkit.event.block.BlockBreakEvent event)

                   byte data,
                   @NonNull
                   org.bukkit.Location bloc)

      • getLimiter

        @NonNull
public static TRLimiter getLimiter(@NonNull
                           java.lang.String playerName)
        First checks all loaded limiters.
        If it cannot find this player's limiter, it will look into the database.
        If that also results in nothing, it will create a new limiter.
        Returns:
        The limiter the given player has. If it doesn't exist, it creates one.

      • getOnlineLimiter

        @NonNull
public static TRLimiter getOnlineLimiter(@NonNull
                                 org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Returns:
        The limiter the given player has. If it doesn't exist, it creates one.

      • loadLimitFromString

        @NonNull
private static TRLimit loadLimitFromString(@NonNull
                                  java.lang.String ins)
        Note: You should add the locations in this limit to allBlockOwners after calling this method.

      • saveLimiters

        public static void saveLimiters()
        Save the limiters to the database.

      • setExpire

        public static void setExpire(@NonNull
             java.lang.String player)
        Called by QuitListener.quit(Player) to make a players limits expire (after 6x32 = 192 ticks) when he logs off.
        See Also:
        QuitListener.quit(Player), tekkitrestrict#initHeartBeat()

      • deLoadLimiter

        private static void deLoadLimiter(@NonNull
                 TRLimiter limitBlock)
        IMPORTANT: set Changing to true before using this and to false after using this. Dynamically unload a player (after they logout).
        Saves the limiter first, then uses limitBlock.clearLimits() and then uses limiters.remove(limitBlock)
        See Also:
        saveLimiter(TRLimiter)

      • saveLimiter

        private static void saveLimiter(@NonNull
               TRLimiter lb)
        Saves 1 limiter to the database.

      • locParse

        @Nullable
private static TRLocation locParse(java.lang.String ins)
        Parses a String formatted like "world,x,y,z" to a location.

      • init

        public static void init()
        load all of the block:player pairs from db.

      • manageData

        public static void manageData()
        Manages and removes bad data. Determines if the limit exists at a location. If not, remove it. Called by limiter manager

      • expireLimiters

        public static void expireLimiters()
        Called by the heartbeat to unload limits of players that are offline.
        See Also:
        Uses deLoadLimiter(TRLimitBlock), Called by tekkitrestrict.initHeartBeat()

      • removeExpire

        public static void removeExpire(@NonNull
                java.lang.String playerName)
        Called when a player logs in to make his limits not expire any more.

      • getPlayerAt

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String getPlayerAt(@NonNull
                                    org.bukkit.block.Block block)
        Returns:
        The owner of this block, or null if none is found.

      • getDebugInfo

        @NonNull
public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getDebugInfo()
